documents.document: @Morgan_Jones @shoelessgirl Tell me about it!
@dimsie @gtiso Iâ€™m totally willing to swallow a lot of rats. Been involved in politics for too long not to. But some? Not even with sauce.
@shoelessgirl Yes & no. But I canâ€™t vote if such a vote is across a moral line for me. Oâ€™Connor isnâ€™t my only concern, but he adds to such.
@gtiso @dimsie This my quandary, and that rat may indeed be too big to swallow.
@amscraig @hadyngreen Thank you! Will add that to my autocorrect.
@amscraig @hadyngreen Yeah, living in Wadestown, my electorate shifted on me, moving me from Wellington Central to Ohariu. So very aware.
@thomasbeagle @kyhwana No, itâ€™s moved to Miramar.
@tui_talk @lcsnz Oh, I donâ€™t expect them to rule it out, as much as I would like them to. But if they appear to be considering it, then no.
@mysphoria @lcsnz Indeed, and it should. The choice scares me, because of how much I believe in our institutions. But I will wield it.
@mysphoria @lcsnz This is why I am weighing this choice so heavily. And why I may not be the only one doing so.
@tui_talk @lcsnz As I said, if the Greens put up an alternative in Ohariu, AND do not look to partner with NZF in gov, then Iâ€™ll vote.
@tui_talk @lcsnz No. But I have a line I will not cross.. If those are the consequences I will be sad. But I will not do anything to win.
@mysphoria @lcsnz Why do you think I am resisting resigning my Greens membership? Your thought that I am doing this lightly is insulting.
@tui_talk @lcsnz Iâ€™m sorry, but giving in to whatever they want in order to win, including partnering with NZF, is not something I will do.
@tui_talk @lcsnz No, my main priority is voting to my morals, NZF is but just aspect.
@mysphoria @lcsnz I will not stand by and say â€œanything to winâ€ for if we do that, weâ€™re not truly winning.
@mysphoria @lcsnz That voting is a tool, to be used with power, and responsibility, and import. Not to be taken for granted. By anyone.
@tui_talk @lcsnz The more we give over votes to them regardless of what they do, or who they partner with, the more they will do so.
@mysphoria @lcsnz â€¦ government, THEN I will vote. But if they do not, I will not.
@mysphoria @lcsnz IF the Greens put up an alternative to Oâ€™Connor in Ohariu, and IF Greens/Labour do not appear to be considering NZF for â€¦
@mysphoria @lcsnz To those in the parties of the left that they cannot take our votes for granted. However small of such.
@mysphoria @lcsnz Sometimes, the act of not voting is an act in and of itself. If it is with intent & reason and engagement in the politics.
@mysphoria @lcsnz This is not a question of if one must compromise, because of course one must. But rather of where is too far.
@mysphoria @lcsnz It is indeed, but there comes a point where the compromise is too much, and I will not meekly hand over my vote.
@mysphoria @lcsnz â€¦ will not compromise beyond where I consider moral. Look down on me as you will, but I will draw a line.
@mysphoria @lcsnz â€¦operates or how to get involved. Elections are HUGE for me. But I do all this because of what I believe in, and I â€¦
@mysphoria @lcsnz â€¦Shaw every weekend at the markets, sometimes multiple markets. Please do not dare to lecture me on how politics â€¦
@mysphoria @lcsnz I have campaigned, lobbied, staffed, sat-in, marched, walked the line. In the last election I worked a booth for James â€¦
@mysphoria @lcsnz Of course I have hon. Do you honestly think I havenâ€™t? My disappointment goes beyond Oâ€™Connor.
@mysphoria @lcsnz If I cannot vote my principles, then voting becomes meaningless to me.
@mysphoria @lcsnz I know, which is why I am considering abstaining seriously and with import.
@mysphoria @lcsnz Me too, but I canâ€™t see acceding to whatever the left parties do is a solution.
@lcsnz @mysphoria She did indeed, but the â€œvote for her or elseâ€ method that was used by many was not successful
@mysphoria @lcsnz Opting out of voting is a viable choice. Itâ€™s an extreme one, but it is one I am prepared for if I canâ€™t vote my consience
@lcsnz @mysphoria Except in the states that mattered. Like it or not (and I donâ€™t personally) the electoral college was where it mattered.
@mysphoria @lcsnz Sure, please, try to shame me into voting. That worked excellently for Clintonâ€™s camp too.
@lcsnz They need to learn that they cannot take our votes for granted. That there are limits to our complicity.
@li_politico I KNOW. Turned that shit off as soon as I found I could.
@formerlyfrozen @cmranapia @li_politico Guys, can I politely suggest this isnâ€™t the thread to debate the rigours of Rowlingâ€™s writing?
@jondauthor Welcome to how misogyny operates.
@buzzandhum If I donâ€™t see some obscure Heinlein & Asimov references from you soon, Iâ€™m going to be very disappointed.
@jondauthor Because those are considered appropriate boy nerd things.
@southernlimitnz Though if someone disrespects the Oxford Comma, all bets are off.
@li_politico Yes, some of us are intellectuals AND love Harry Potter AND love seeing people use whatever literature to engage with the world
@thelittlepakeha @reaverbait All literature wishes it had the power to do that.
@thelittlepakeha @reaverbait Exactly, itâ€™s something that people know, and love, and use to make sense of the world around them, to express.
@buzzandhum Thereâ€™s a reason itâ€™s a cultural touchstone, and resonates with so many. It has power in that.
@southernlimitnz I will admit, Iâ€™ve been guilty of that in the past. Been something Iâ€™ve tried to get myself out of in the past few years.
@reaverbait But even if I didnâ€™t, I wonâ€™t imply their stupidity just for choosing that particular literature to engage through.
@reaverbait Iâ€™ve read a LOT of books, and Iâ€™ve on the whole liked & enjoyed the Potter-universe comparisons.
@reaverbait For instance, how do you know this the only book/series they have read? Theyâ€™ve merely chosen to engage through this piece.
When your intellectual snobbery makes you feel good about shaming how people engage with politics through literaturâ€¦ https://t.co/2UWeOuP3om
Ok, @KateMontgom you may be right â€¦ https://t.co/UIYqjkGJdZ
@grumpybirb Iâ€™m sure you can put it off if you want to â€¦ thatâ€™s how these things work, right?
@megapope Well, at least itâ€™s not a beautiful sunny day.
@msvaf Yeah, I feel the same. May not be official as yet, but theyâ€™ll do it.
@lcsnz Iâ€™m not taking this lightly. Voting is about as close to a sacred act as it comes for me. But my conscience will not let me on these.
@lcsnz Iâ€™m sorry hon, but there are lines on how Iâ€™m willing to compromise on when voting. And these are over such.
@lcsnz If the Greens/Labour look like partnering with NZF to form a government, then my party vote will be withheld too.
@lewsos â€œIf you have more money to spend, you can save! This is an excellent scheme!â€
Wearing boots today because, you know #WellingtonSummer
This is my electorate. Moving closer to not voting this election. https://t.co/ob7qVvIMBm
@pr0gger Tell me about it, on the train rn, not caffeinated. I may be a danger to people.
If I see one more piece saying "x really bad thing from Trump is a DISTRACTION and you SHOULD be paying attention to y!!" I'm gonna scream.
TFW you oversleep and so run out of time to make espresso in the morning ðŸ˜¥#firstworldproblems
@mssocks You can see they're trying, so much. But for the first time in the series, it's just not working. It's painful.
Lying in bed, eating ice-cream, listening to Rachel Maddow #selfcare
@kiwibookgirl Oh goodness yes, Sara & Nyssa had INCREDIBLE chemistry ... with Talia now present, Nyssa might be back :)
@kiwibookgirl I miss Kara & James. Tho more so, I miss Cat Grant.
@kiwibookgirl Definitely. And I'd like to see Kara & Mon-El have a brother-sister kind of thing. Or mentor-mentee thing.
@kiwibookgirl I mean, I know I'm biased, but Kara has more chemistry with Lena Luthor than she does with Mon-El.
@kiwibookgirl Oh goodness yes, Alex and Maggie just spark next to each other. Kara & Mon-El seem all the more so flat in comparison.
Stop trying to make Kara & Mon-El happen. Seriously, they have no chemistry #Supergirl
@kathleenkr One might suggest to them to not eat fast food :)
@kathleenkr Goodness, it's almost like they're in another country.
@kathleenkr What are they complaining about?
@MorganGodfery You know, when does it stop being satire because it's too damn close to what actually occurred?

Right, fuck this taking a break from social media shit â€¦. Iâ€™m rejecting that privilege for myself. Not everyone can take a break.
@lightyouonfire @jess_mcallen But you really need to think to yourself what you really want, and other ways to get that.
@lightyouonfire @jess_mcallen Academia is like this; unless youâ€™re looking at Tier 1 research universities, youâ€™re considered not real.
@LI_politico You know, I think I'm going to take a break from Twitter for a little bit. This is fucked up, this is all too fucked up.

The AG defends the Constitution and serves at the pleasure of the President. Seems they didn't expect these things to be in conflict.
@Lesleyattalk @StuFlemingNZ If your quibble is with the label, rather than the structural forces that produce inequality, I just don't know.
@Lesleyattalk BUT THEY HAVE WHITE MALE PRIVILEGE. BECAUSE THEY'RE WHITE AND MALE.
@Lesleyattalk @StuFlemingNZ Oh I give up. Read up on social science, I don't have time for people that don't understand this basic shit.
@David_Cormack Yeah, even tho her job was to defend the constitution, she serves at the pleasure of the president. Unfortunately.
@Lesleyattalk They all have structural privilege by virtue of being white & male. That's how these things work.
@Lesleyattalk I'm sorry, but ignoring how white male privilege operates here merely allows it to operate unchallenged.
